snippet: The premiere of a new production, by Damiano Michieletto, was met with boos from the audience at the Royal Opera House in London.
abstract: Audience explodes with boos, catcalls and chants of 'shoot the director' in response to sexually violent scene shown during premiere of Royal Opera House production of Rossini opera Guillaume Tell; opera company says it will not change staging but places more explicit warning on website that performance contains brief nudity and sexual violence.
lead_paragraph: The premiere of a new production, by Damiano Michieletto, was met with boos from the audience at the Royal Opera House in London.

headline.main: ‘Guillaume Tell,’ at Royal Opera House, Draws Criticism for Violence and Nudity
headline.print_headline: A Brutal Scene Is Met by Criticism
